file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-12-03-04 - AILERON DAMPER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL AILERON DAMPER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD SB 145-27-0063 OR FAA/CTA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the aileron damper. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ON AIRCRAFT POST- MOD SB 145-27-0063 27-12-03-000-801-A AILERON DAMPER - REMOVAL OR FAA/CTA-CERTI- FIED AIRCRAFT ON AIRCRAFT POST- MOD SB 145-27-0063 27-12-03-400-801-A AILERON DAMPER - INSTALLATION OR FAA/CTA-CERTI- FIED AIRCRAFT ON AIRCRAFT POST- MOD SB 145-27-0063 27-12-03-040-801-A AILERON DAMPER - DEACTIVATION OR FAA/CTA-CERTI- FIED AIRCRAFT ON AIRCRAFT POST- MOD SB 145-27-0063 27-12-03-440-801-A AILERON DAMPER - REACTIVATION OR FAA/CTA-CERTI- FIED AIRCRAFT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-12-03 Page 1 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-12-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD SB 145-27-0063 OR FAA/CTA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT 2. AILERON DAMPER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the aileron damper. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH HTS AMM TASK 57-56-04-000-801-A/400 AILERON LOWER SHROUD - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the aileron control system in the neu- GSE 058 Kit, rig pin, flight controls tral position E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Do not do other tasks on the aileron system. (2) Release the pressure of the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (3) Remove the aileron lower shroud (AMM TASK 57-56-04-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 2 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Install the rig pin (GSE 058) to the aileron fuselage sector. Refer to Figure 401. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: • THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. • CA-1000 CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURERS' HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (1) Remove bolt (14) and washers (10), (12), and (13) to release jumper (11) from the wing side and (21) from the aileron side. Refer to DET. C (2) Remove the hose (4) and union (3) from the damper (1). Remove and discard the O- ring (2). Put a cap on the hose end. Refer to DET. B (3) Remove and discard the cotter pins (5) and (20). Refer to DET. B and DET. D. (4) Remove the bolt (15), washers (16) and (18), bushing (17), and nut (19) to remove the damper (1) from the aileron. Refer to DET. D. (5) Remove the bolt (9), bushing (8), washers (7), and nut (6) to remove the damper (1) from the wing. Refer to DET. B. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 3 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

A PCA INPUT ROD PRIMARY AILERON WING SECTOR BACKSTOP RIG PIN DET. B EM145AMM270916A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 4 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD SB 145-27-0063 OR FAA/CTA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT Aileron Damper - Removal/Installation Figure 402 AILERON HYDRAULIC SYS 2 PRESSURE LINE B DET. A AILERON HYDRAULIC SYS 2 RETURN LINE A 1 4. HOSE AILERON SUPPORT ZONES (REF.) 551 3. UNION 651 2. O-RING D 5. COTTER C PIN DET. B 3 6. NUT 1. DAMPER 20. COTTER PIN C 7. WASHER 2 19. NUT 8. BUSHING 18. WASHER WING SUPPORT 9. BOLT (REF.) DAMPER CA-1000 (REF.) 15. BOLT 4 17. BUSHING 14. BOLT 10. WASHER 16. WASHER CA-1000 DAMPER DET. D 13. WASHER (REF.) AILERON SUPPORT 12. WASHER (REF.) 1 11/21. JUMPER TORQUE: 10.7-11.9 N.m (95-105 lbf.in) 2 TORQUE: 5.6-6.8 N.m (50-60 lbf.in) DET. C 3 4 (TYPICAL) TORQUE: 7.9-9.2 N.m (70-90 lbf.in) APPLY BLUE LACQUER EM145AMM270911A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 5 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-12-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD SB 145-27-0063 OR FAA/CTA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT 3. AILERON DAMPER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the aileron damper. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AILERON POWER-CONTROL ACTUATOR (PCA) - RE- AMM TASK 27-12-01-000-801-A/400 MOVAL AMM TASK 27-12-03-870-801-A/300 AILERON DAMPER BLEEDING AMM TASK 57-56-04-400-801-A/400 AILERON LOWER SHROUD - INSTALLATION IPC 27-12-00 AILERON HYDRAULIC ACTUATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the aileron control system in the neu- GSE 058 Kit, rig pin, flight controls tral position GSE 070 Digital Protractor To measure the deflections of the aileron. E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) As nec- MEP 09-060 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound essary As nec- MS20995C20 Lockwire essary As nec- TT-L-32 Blue Lacquer essary EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 6 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring IPC 27-12-00 1/LRU cotter pin IPC 27-12-00 1/LRU cotter pin IPC 27-12-00 1/LRU H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A • WARNING: THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. • CA-1000 CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURERS' HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (1) Apply corrosion-inhibiting compound as shown in Figure 402. For this, use gloves and goggles. (2) Use the bolt (9), bushing (8), washers (7), and nut (6) to install the damper (1) to the wing. Refer to DET. B. (3) Use the bolt (15), washers (16) and (18), bushing (17), and nut (19) to install the damper (1) to the aileron. Refer to DET. D. (4) Install the union (3) and O-ring (2) to the damper (1). Apply torque as shown in Figure 402. Then, install the hose (4). Apply torque to the hose (4) as shown in Figure 402. Refer to DET. B. (5) Remove the rig pin (GSE 058) from the aileron fuselage sector. Refer to Figure 401. (6) Do the check of the deflection of the aileron as follows. (a) Install Digital Protractor GSE 070 to the aileron. For this, use a double-face adhesive-tape. (b) Set the aileron to the neutral position. NOTE: The neutral position of the aileron occurs when the aileron and the wing trailing edges are aligned. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 7 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Disconnect the PCA from the aileron surface ( AMM TASK 27-12-01-000-801-A/ 400). (d) Manually move the aileron up and down. Refer to Table 401 for the aileron correct deflection. Table 401 - AILERON DEFLECTION [1] AILERON UP 29.2 degrees ÃÂ± 1 degree [1] AILERON DOWN 20 degrees ÃÂ± 1 degree [1] These deflections are applicable when the aileron is disconnected from the PCA and the damper is installed to the aileron. (e) If necessary, cut the lockwire of the rod end of the damper and adjust until you get these deflections. Then, safety it. (f) Remove the digital protractor from the aileron. (7) Torque as shown in (Figure 402). Install the cotter pins (5) and (20). (8) Use the bolt (14) and washers (10), (12), and (13) to install the jumper (11) to the wing side and (21) to the aileron side. Apply a thin coat of the blue lacquer, specification TT- L-32, in the bolt, washers and jumper, after assemblage. (9) Reconnect the PCA to the aileron surface ( AMM TASK 27-12-01-000-801-A/400) J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Bleed the aileron damper (AMM TASK 27-12-03-870-801-A/300). (2) Install the aileron lower shroud (AMM TASK 57-56-04-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 8 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-12-03-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD SB 145-27-0063 OR FAA/CTA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT 4. AILERON DAMPER - DEACTIVATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to deactivate the aileron damper. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AILERON PCA ROD ENDS/FITTING LUGS FOR IN- AMM TASK 27-12-01-200-802-A/600 TEGRITY AND GENERAL CONDITION - GENERAL VISUAL INSPECTION AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH HTS AMM TASK 57-56-04-000-801-A/400 AILERON LOWER SHROUD - REMOVAL AMM TASK 57-56-04-400-801-A/400 AILERON LOWER SHROUD - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Do not do other tasks on the aileron system. (2) Release the pressure of the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (3) Remove the aileron lower shroud (AMM TASK 57-56-04-000-801-A/400). (4) Install the rig pin (GSE 058) to the aileron fuselage sector. J. Deactivation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 040-002-A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 9 of 12 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Perform the aileron damper removal procedure SUBTASK 27-12-03-020-001-A00. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Pressurize the aircraft hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (2) Make sure that there are no leaks at the cap. (3) Install the aileron lower shroud (AMM TASK 57-56-04-400-801-A/400). (4) Do a visual inspection of the PCA rod ends and fittings as given in AMM TASK 27-12-01-200-802-A/600. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 10 of 12 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

General (1) This task gives the procedures to reactivate the aileron damper. B. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) cotter pin IPC 27-12-00 1/LRU cotter pin IPC 27-12-00 1/LRU H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Do not do other tasks on the aileron system. (2) Release the pressure of the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (3) Remove the aileron lower shroud (AMM TASK 57-56-04-000-801-A/400). J. Reactivation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 440-002-A (1) Do the aileron damper installation procedure SUBTASK 27-12-03-420-002-A00. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-004-A (1) Remove the rig pin (GSE 058) from the aileron fuselage sector. (2) Bleed the aileron damper (AMM TASK 27-12-03-870-801-A/300). (3) Install the aileron lower shroud (AMM TASK 57-56-04-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 27-12-03 Page 12 of 12 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
